column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat|salience|identity|centering
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent

#Summary1=(human1) In a speech, the digital minister of Taiwan discusses the technological cooperation between private citizens and the national government to gather atmospheric and meteorological data as well as other projects with similar private and public partnerships.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) A Taiwanese official describes how citizens created an open-source air quality monitoring network with over 2,000 nodes, leading to government collaboration and a broader digital transformation strategy focused on collective intelligence and shared technological development.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) In Taiwan, civic innovation empowers citizens to monitor air quality with IoT devices, uploading real-time data to a public blockchain, fostering citizen-government collaboration and bridging digital divides through the Civil IoT project, which emphasizes open-source partnerships and a human-centered digital transformation.

#Summary4=(Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) In Taiwan, a network of sensors and IoT devices, called AirBox, has been installed by over 2,000 people to monitor air quality and share data in real-time, promoting a culture of civic space and open innovation, and challenging the traditional approach of government agencies to manage environmental issues.

#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Taiwanese citizens and organizations are utilizing open-source, low-cost air quality sensors and a distributed ledger system to monitor and share air pollution data, fostering a culture of collaboration and transparency while challenging governmental authority and addressing digital divides within the country.
#Text=When I tour around Taiwan , of course , I also find people taking action without even waiting for the ministries to take action .
#Text=This is another of the g0v projects the environmental agency .
#Text=If you change the O to a zero , you get into them , considering environmental agency .
#Text=This is what people care about , the air quality , PM 2.5 in Taiwan .
#Text=More than 2,000 people , actually , installed these in their balconies , in their schools and so on , to get a real - time sensor of their IoT devices but not just IoT .
#Text=They also upload it to the public cloud , which then uploads it to a distributed ledger to make sure that nobody can modify those numbers after the fact .
#Text=After that , we see this kind of innovation is very rare in Asia .
#Text=When I talk to all the UN - related bodies , many other Asian countries tell me that they wo n't let this network grow to be 2,000 nodes strong .
#Text=If it 's 200 nodes strong , they will try to poach the leader to the government .
#Text=If they refuse , then maybe , they get disappeared because they really challenge the legitimacy of the environmental agency .

#Text=If the environmental agency group reports one number and your neighbors report another number , of course , you 're going to trust the one that you participated yourself , even though it 's a lower quality sensor .
#Text=Because of that , it 's very rare in Taiwan because we have an expanding civic space .
#Text=The government takes the approach of , " we ca n't beat them , let 's join them " .
#Text=We manufacture low - cost , high - precision sensors for them , but we also see this as a map of digital gap in Taiwan , a digital divide .
#Text=We set up points when the people do n't have the resource to go to , indigenous places , places in the mountains .
#Text=We also talk to the citizen scientists and they say they really want a point here to tell the air pollution from outside Taiwan or from inside Taiwan , domestically .
#Text=There 's no way the citizen scientists can install an AirBox there , even if they 're very good at drones and so on .
#Text=It 's impossible to stay there forever .
#Text=We can because we have wind turbines .
#Text=That 's electricity generators , power plants , over there .
#Text=We can install those sensor networks as part of the complementary action .
#Text=The beauty is this , it 's all open hardware .
#Text=It 's all open source .
#Text=It 's on GitHub .
#Text=You just download , put it onto Raspberry Pi , and then , you can do it yourself , as people have done over the world .
#Text=If you do n't change the source code , it uploads to the Taiwan network by default , so we kind of have the numbers of all the atmosphere and meteorological data .

#Text=We have a website dedicated for this , the Civil IoT project at CI.taiwan.gov.tw , that is basically , collective intelligence , meteorological , air quality , earthquake , and disaster prevention , and things like that .
#Text=We have single websites like this , CI for Collective Intelligence , AI for AI Taiwan , SI for Social Innovation , Smart Taiwan for the Smart Taiwan plan , and also , Bio Taiwan .
#Text=The medical industry says , " You really should call it biomed.taiwan because bio and med are different things . "
#Text=Biomed Taiwan goes to the same website as Bio Taiwan .
#Text=In any case , what we 're doing is now is breaking across ministry and municipality and national government because this says nothing about the level of the government or the departments .
#Text=It is one , single message that is collaboratively curated by everybody .
#Text=Through this , we solved not just our local social and environmental issues through economic approaches but using the SDGs as a map to unite the efforts together .
#Text=Just by saying " Taiwan can help " , we mean specifically , 17 , 18 , which is the availability of reliable data that people from across sectors , across jurisdictions , can trust the data .
#Text=Then , based on the data , we encourage cross-sectoral partnerships .
#Text=Then , based on that , we make open innovations that we , then , export , not as colonizers but , really , co-creators .
#Text=Just download it on GitHub and then , we devise something together in a way that has free access to science and technology .
#Text=When I joined the cabinet two years ago , based on these ideas -- with a contract -- the administration asked me for a job description , because they 've never seen anything like this before .
#Text=Instead of a job description , I just wrote them a poem , a prayer , which I 'm going to read to you as a conclusion .
#Text=To me , it means the shift from IT or ICT to digital , the shift from the sectors separately as attack or an innovation , or whatever , into the humanity as a whole .
#Text=This is digital transformation for me .
#Text=This is , literally , my job description .
#Text=It goes like this .
#Text=" When we see the Internet of Things , let 's make it an Internet of Beings .
